meanings.definition: A road that is larger or more important than others.
meanings.sent1: The superroad was wide and had many lanes for cars to drive on.
meanings.sent2: The government invested in building a superroad to connect the two cities.
meanings.sent3: The superroad felt like a grand pathway for cars to travel on.
meanings.sent4: The superroad stood out among the smaller streets like a giant ribbon cutting through the city.
meanings.sent5: The superroad was so massive that it seemed to stretch on forever, dominating the landscape.

meanings.definition: To build or improve a road to make it larger or more important.
meanings.sent1: The city decided to superroad the highway to accommodate more traffic.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers worked tirelessly to superroad the main street in town.
meanings.sent3: The mayor joked that they should superroad all the roads in town to make them grander.
meanings.sent4: The engineers were tasked with superroading the rural road into a modern expressway.
meanings.sent5: The project manager's goal was to superroad the infrastructure to boost economic development.
